content: center of last st of round pull yarn gently through pull through 2 loops st yo pull through all 3 loops on your hook anchor join by drawing through any back loop of first dc3tog and last sts of round and weave in ends yo insert hook in double_crochet yo pull up a loop yo and pull video at a yarn of serendipity through 2 loops fpsc yo insert hook in next double_crochet yo pull up a loop yo and insert hook from front-to-back-to-front around post pull through 2 loops 2 times so post is in front of hook yo and pull up a loop yo pull through all 4 loops on your hook yo and pull through remaining 2 loops on hook fptr bpsc yo 2 times insert hook from front to-back-to-front insert hook from back-to-front-to-back around post around post so post is in front of hook so post is in back of your hook yo and pull up a loop yo and pull up a loop yo through 2 loops 3 times yo and pull through remaining 2 loops on hook bl fphdc when instructed to work into the back loops insert yo insert hook from front-to-back-to-front around hook only under back loop form and complete st as post so post is in front of hook yo pull up a loop usual yo pull through all 3 loops on hook cable st bphdc skip st double_crochet in next 3 sts yo insert hook into skipped st yo insert hook from back-to-front-to-back around and around posts of 3 double_crochet post so post is in back of hook yo pull up a loop yo pull loop up to height of double_crochet yo pull through 2 yo pull through all 3 loops on hook loops 2 times long double_crochet shallow post st insert hook into v part of st front and back loop of st and complete indicated stitch marley mae square a yarn of serendipity copyright © 2023 page 2 of 20 3lp of single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet yo of the single_crochet and last yo of half_double_crochet double_crochet and treble_crochet st create the single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet and treble_crochet sts all have two main loops the v on 3rd loop top of each st is known as the fl front loop and bl back loop symbol guide asterisks * to repeat instructions after a single asterisk as directed example *single_crochet in chain-1 space chain 1 skip next half_double_crochet single_crochet in next chain-1 space chain 1 skip next fpdc repeat from * around parentheses indicates a group of sts that are worked together in or around the same st i also use parentheses to indicate the name of sts skipped example #1 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain-2 space example #2 skip next 2 half_double_crochet chain-1 space 2 half_double_crochet brackets repeat instructions within brackets as directed example double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in next double_crochet chain 1 skip treble_crochet 2 times count totals total chain spaces are included in the st
